alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 01 at 5:36PM AKDT until April 02 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions occuring until 10PM. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting to 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected after 10PM. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 PM AKDT this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are occuring this afternoon and will this evening as winds decrease. Visibility will drop again late tonight as winds turn northwest and increase again. Those conditions will improve late Sunday morning as winds decrease.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
